From the amount of clothes we have ruined pouring silicone, you can trust us that it won't fade in the wash! We’ll follow up with you after the campaign about size and color preferences.

column1: Comingle Party Pack

Want to have a fun sexy party. For $25 we’ll send you some condoms and lube with our logo on them, as well as some stickers and temporary tattoos that you can use to boldly proclaim your support of open-source sex tech.
Adopt a Homeless Dildo

We make lots of dildos to test our molds and colors and sometimes just because we can. If you choose this perk, you get one of these adorable dildos that’s just looking for a nice place to call home. These guys don’t vibrate, but they look really cool. $25 gets you a small dildo. Increase your pledge to $35 if you’d like one of the larger ones. (As with many of our items, some might even glow in the dark!)
Make it Glow
Add $14 to your dildo or other silicone contribution if you want it to GLOW! Add $7 and we'll throw in a UV laser to draw on it!
Dilduino and Motors

If you want to start from the ground up, this is the way to do it. The Dilduino is the Arduino-based platform that runs the Mod. It includes three motor driver circuits and a USB recharging circuit for a LiPo battery, so it’s really easy to embed in your project. You can program it from scratch using Arduino, or use our OSSex library to make selecting inputs and driving the motors easier.

The motors are the most powerful vibrating motors we could find that operate at 3.3 volts. You can really tell the difference between them and some of the tiny vibration motors that you find all over the place.
$60 gets you the fully assembled board and three vibration motors. We’ll leave the motors unattached to give you more flexibility.
Dilduino and Snow Crash Kit
Want to build your own Electronic Hallucinogens? Try out some digital psychedelia with flashing light patterns? It's crazy but fun!
We will send you the dilduino plus all the components necessary to build your own shocking kit. It can also be used as a TENS unit for stimulating muscles. We have full documentation here.
The Mod

Be one of the first to own this great vibrator and get a head start exploring your own techno-sexual fantasies. You get all the features of a great vibrator: 3 powerful motors in a firm yet bendy shaft, 100% body safe silicone, USB recharging, and lots of great patterns that you can control using the built in buttons.

Every Mod purchased through this campaign comes with a Nunchuck controller. We have made it plug-and-play for you, and it's a great way to directly control each motor and manipulate patterns while they run. It will also include a USB micro cable for charging and reprograming.
Select this perk if you want to have a good time as soon as possible, and you’ll be ready for the release of our plug-and-play accessories for things like heartbeat detection and music syncing.
The Mod + Sensor Pack

If you want to dig a little deeper into attaching sensors and programing your Mod, choose this perk, and you’ll get everything that comes with the Mod (Vibrator, Nunchuck, and USB cable) and a collection of sensors that you can use to control the motors and patterns from your Mod.

Unlike some of the peripherals (like the Wii Nunchuck), the sensors in the pack won’t be directly plug-and-play. You’ll have to build some simple circuits around them and program the Mod to work with them. We’ll have lots of illustrated sample circuits and code on our website, though, to get you started quick.
You’ll get the following components in the Sensor Pack:
<ul>
• Bend Sensor + Resistor
• Pressure Sensor + Resistor
• Capacitive Touch Components
• Microphone
• Small Breadboard
• Conductive Fabric and Conductive Thread
• Potentiometer
• Jumper Wires
<div>
The Mod + Snow Crash
Check out our tutorial on making electrodes that can make you hallucinate crazy patterns of light. You can connect your kit right up to your dildo and have a CRAZY TIME!
Sexy Workshop

An important part of Comingle is helping people explore their sexuality through hacking. Workshops are a big part of us accomplishing that mission. For $1800 plus the cost of flights and hotel rooms, we will come to your event, party, or jungle expedition to run a workshop about electronics, coding, and sexuality.

Workshops can be targeted for absolute beginners up to Arduino experts and can be tailored to suit your needs. We’ll sort out the details with you in plenty of time to make it to your event, but we can’t do any workshops before May. Just choose this perk and contribute $1800, and we’ll get the conversation started.
(Here's a little workshop/talk we had in Good Vibrations in San Francisco)
Sexy Workshop On a Plane

We’re just as fancy as all those other fancy dildo companies, and to prove it, for the low, low price of $40,000, we’ll host a workshop for you and three of your friends on a private plane. You all get Mods and a bunch of accessories, and you’ll learn how to hack it at 40,000 feet (that works out to just $1.00/foot!). This sounds like a LOT of fun to us, so we’d love it if someone claimed this perk.
<ol>
• How will you make money if you give away all your designs?

We will sell components, kits, and sex toys to people who don’t have access to tools, the time, or the desire to make their own dildos from the ground up. For people who do want to make their own vibrators, we’ll have the info available, but for others, the documentation is as much about inspiring new ideas as it is about duplicating our products and projects.
• Will you ship your products discreetly?

Yes, by default we will ship all products super discreetly in nondescript cardboard boxes.  For people who have a personal relationship with their mail carriers, though, we also provide an indiscreet shipping option.
• What color will the Mod come in?

As you see in our photos and videos, the Mod could come in a dizzying array of colors. We'll offer the Mod in solid colors and with a metallic finish, and hopefully be able to offer glow in the dark and marbled colors as well. We'll communicate with our backers after the campaign about color options.
• In your videos and How-to articles, I keep seeing different sizes and shapes of dildos? What's going on?

All the Mods you see in our documentation are prototypes. We made the different shapes to test different forms and to figure out how best to embed electronics in silicone. Here's a rendering of the shape of form of what you'll be getting. It won't have any rough edges, and the ports will have a cover to keep out water and lube.
• What do you mean by Gender-neutral?
We tried to design this toy to be fun no matter what you have between your legs. It's designed to hit g-spots, prostates, clits, glans, and taints of all sorts.
• What business do three white dudes have making sex toys for ladies?

First of all, butts. We’ve all got ‘em and our vibes are super good for all of them. Second of all, you’re totally right, we’re privileged. We had the benefit of having the opportunity to and encouragement to pursue education and careers in science and technology, and we’re really grateful for that. Sex is fun for everyone, and we hope that our work can help grow interest in technology, but we’ll always be looking for feedback from people with backgrounds, body types, and identities different from our own.

By leaving the design open and accessible, we encourage you to make the Mod truly yours. We've had beta testers tell us that certain vibration patterns didn't do it for them, and it was no problem for them to change the pattern or remove it completely.

Finally, we understand that different people like different things. We know that one shape of the Mod won't work for everyone. We hope that by having a successful campaign, we can produce the Mod in many different forms and continue to create resources for people wanting to create and modify their own toys.
","The Mod is a great vibrator. It's made from 100% silicone.
Its three powerful motors create amazing sensations, ranging from a lovely low
frequency rumble to patterns that move up and down the shaft. It is USB rechargeable,
and its built in buttons make it easy to control vibration patterns and
intensities.
You can customize the Mod by downloading apps from our
website or by connecting plug-and-play controllers that sync it with your
partner's heartbeat, connect it to your smartphone, or anything else you can
think of.
We'll provide online tools that make it easy to design your
own vibration patterns, or if you're so inclined, you can write your own
programs that completely change how the Mod behaves using our well documented
API.
If you've ever had an idea for a cool sex toy or if you want
a vibrator that you can change to match your mood, the Mod is the vibe for you.
The Vibrator
As a vibrator, the Mod can compete with some of the most popular toys on the market.

Customized Play - No Programming RequiredYou can easily change how your Mod works by just quickly loading different apps onto it from our website. Giving your Mod different superpowers is as easy as that! No programming needed!We’ve already been having tons of fun controlling the Mod in all sorts of sexy ways. Your Mod will come with a Wii Nunchuck standard to give you some fun ways to directly control the vibration motors. Here are just a few of the other things we’ve already built to control the Mod:

Integrated Button - The Mod has a mode button on the handle that you can use to change patterns, change vibration intensity, or trigger individual motors. Instructions on our website make it easy to change the button behavior.

Nunchuck - A standard, simple, and powerful control for the toy. The joystick can manipulate power and pulsing patterns. Shaking the nunchuck's accelerometer can modulate the frequency of the vibrations. To fulfill one major request from Beta testers, we also programmed the ""C"" button as an easy ""kill switch"" to shut the toy off right when you come!
Video chat - We process the image coming from a webcam. The more movement in the image, the more intense the Mod’s response.

Capacitive Touch Sensing - Quickly and easily turn most objects in the world into touch-sensitive interfaces for pleasure (ever heard of a Makey-Makey? It's like that!). Trigger your partner's toy by sucking on a banana, or spanking them with a spatula. Connect to a body piercing and turn your partner's whole body into a touchable dildo controller. Many objects can even by used like a Theremin, responding to proximity as well as touch.
Biometrics - A heartbeat sensor lets you feel your partner’s arousal in the throbbing toy. This one is a real favorite — it's super cool to feel the rhythm increase with your partner's excitement.
Web - Make interfaces directly within a web browser. Great for cyber sex, or giving web-geeks a quick way to control their toys!
Soft circuits - A soft stroke sensor that triggers vibrations based on touch. Could be really cool embedded in the tail of a fur suit!
We plan to offer a variety of easy-to-use accessories that plug directly in to the Mod so you won't need electronics skills or supplies to play with fun sensors. What will you build?
Motors
Patterns - Three motors can simulate movement
column3: and create opportunities for other couplings of input and output.

column1: Power and Frequency - Using multiple small motors also gives you control over a broader range of powers and frequencies. Combining the outputs of different motors generates the nice, low-frequency (rumbly) vibrations usually only found in larger devices.
Materials

We use 100% body-safe platinum cure silicone for the Mod. Since we are committed to open-source, we’ll always give you as much information as possible so that you can verify the properties of all the materials we use. We currently use Smooth-On’s Sorta Clear and Dragon Skin silicones to make our Mods and will require all of our manufacturing partners to be transparent about their materials.
Battery

The Mod comes with an 875 mAh battery and is recharged with a USB micro cable (same as your Android phone). Just connect it to a computer or a phone charger. Battery life will depend on your particular setup (power draw of any connected accessories, vibration pattern and intensity), but should last several hours of ""typical"" use.Donations - Free Dildos!For every 100 Mods we sell, we will give 1 to a sex-friendly public hackerspace, non-profit, or academic organization. If you would like to be on our list for potential donations please contact us at info@comingle.io.
Dilduino Platform and OSSex Library

The Mod is controlled by a custom, Arduino-based microcontroller platform called the Dilduino. Since it’s just an Arduino, you can quickly reprogram it using the standard USB micro port. You can also hook-up any sensor to the “Hacker Port” with a normal USB cable.
Dilduino
The Dilduino is a great step forward for small Arduino derivatives. It has many built-in features that are often lacking in many microcontrollers designed for embedded devices:
On-board battery charging - A battery charging circuit makes it easy to connect a Li-ion battery and recharge it over USB.

Integrated Motor driver - The basic output pins on an Arduino are limited to 40 mA of current, which is not nearly enough for really powerful motors. Typically, you would have to connect an external motor-driver circuit to deliver the full power to your vibes, but we built these features directly into the board. Now you can connect up to 500mA per motor channel.

I2C, Analog Inputs, PWM output, and Serial I/O - Our “Hacker Port” is the quickest, most flexible way to incorporate a variety of peripherals in your project. One standard USB port provides regulated 3.3V power and software-switchable pins for Analog, I2C/Two-Wire, or Serial sensors. It also features two PWM output channels in case you want to attach additional motors or lights.
The OSSex Library

The OSSex Arduino library is software to make it easy to reprogram and experiment with your Mod. As far as we know, it's the only freely-available haptic feedback library for Arduino, and we can't wait to flesh it out even more. It’s available now on our Github site. It’s under continuous development, and we welcome anyone to get in touch with us about contributing to it. It currently has several awesome features:

Easy device configuration: tell the software what toy you’re using and it will set up all of your inputs and outputs -- you can read from input 1 and turn on motor 2 without having to know an internal pin-out of the microcontroller.
Built-in functions for running vibration patterns, handling button clicks, and reading inputs

Integrated Input Grooming (Coming Soon):   Most sensors are noisy, and getting good responses from them usually requires incorporating smoothing, statistical, and calibration functions. OSSex will have all these functions built-in to automatically present you with well-groomed data.

Serial console to easily tweak how your Mod behaves without having to do any programming. You can build web apps to talk to your toy with Chrome’s Serial API, control it with your phone, or as one of our beta testers put it, find your sweet spot:

“I was surprised by how much I liked the fast [vibration patterns]. Have you ever watched a cat getting petted by 2+ people at once? It can't figure out how to react, and that's how I felt with those rapid random pulses. I had to make each one last longer than 70 milliseconds (250 ms was my sweet spot), and it felt amazing. Purrrrrrrrr.”
Testing and Iterations

The Mod is a result of over a year of work. Our hyper-fast, iterative prototyping process lets us work out the kinks in our designs and to engineer increasingly refined ways to produce the Mod and our future projects and products.

The Mod started as a basic dildo with six tiny embedded vibration motors and a bunch of wires sticking out. Now, it’s a refined form with embedded hardware and buttons for controlling it. We went from clay and foam models to 3D printed models and silicone glove molds. We started off with an off-the-shelf Lilypad Arduino microcontroller, and then designed and produced a custom Arduino-based solution.

We refined not only the technology, but also the user experience. We sent each version out to beta testers for feedback about how it actually felt and what kinds of projects they’d like to make with it. We incorporated this feedback into subsequent designs and now we have something that we’re confident you’ll enjoy hacking and using.

By funding this campaign at any level, you’re also supporting Comingle. Comingle is more than just an open-source sex toy company. We are working to create a sex-positive community of hackers and techno-sex enthusiasts. We support the growth of this community through the principles of open-source, which enable us to easily and quickly innovate in the areas of stimulation, interaction, and doing it yourself.
Open-source Sex Tech

Sex and DIY have always gone hand-in-hand. We want to maintain that relationship as technology begins to play a greater role in the bedroom. The open-source software and hardware movements have provided excellent examples of how to make great, accessible, and customizable programs and products that encourage exploration. By applying the principles and practices of open-source to sex tech, we can encourage hackers to explore sexuality and people interested in sexuality to explore technology. We enact the principles of open-source in three main ways:

Documentation - We don’t just provide circuit diagrams and source code. We go out of our way to clearly document, with photos and instructions, our production processes, design specifications, tips and tricks, and even our materials and suppliers. We want to make sure that everyone has all the information needed to make one of our products.

Access - A key issue in the typical open-source and the DIY tech community is that it’s only accessible to relatively wealthy and well-educated people. We build and document projects that don’t require tons of space, tools, materials, prior knowledge, or start-up capital to do. We know that some of our projects are out of reach for lots of people and we look for workarounds to decrease the barriers to entry for DIY sex-tech.

Community Engagement - It’s not enough just to post a bunch of information if it’s not easy or useful for the community to understand. We conduct workshops which use our projects to teach software, hardware, and sex-positive ideals. We are also constructing an online space for the community to share and find information about projects, ideas, and sex-tech in general.
A Resource for the Sex Hacker Community

We see Comingle as a resource for the sex-tech community. We will sell components, kits, and complete products that make it easy for hackers of all levels to build the sex tech of their dreams. We’ll also host forums, encourage dialog, and publish instructions from our community. We want to give like-minded people a place to go for sex hacking info and discussion. Finally, we’ll host workshops, hackathons and parties to bring sex-tech to people who might not encounter otherwise.Challenges

Open-source - Remaining open-source in a global supply chain will be complicated. Some suppliers want secrecy, and knock-offs are even easier for other people to make. We’ll do our best to find sympathetic suppliers and protect our brand with a trademark while keeping all the information free. Then, you'll at least know that when you buy something that is made by Comingle, we’ll stand behind it with a guarantee of quality.

Manufacturing - Our anticipated order quantities are in between the number we can make ourselves and the minimum order quantities required by larger manufacturers. Also some of our design decisions may pose challenges for medium-scale manufacturers that we intend to work with. Refining our design so that it has all the features we want while making it easy to manufacture will require us to solve some challenging problems. Our track record with improving our design and manufacturing process shows our ability to solve these problems as we move forward with scaling up manufacturing.

Community Building - Building a product is one thing. Building a community is something else entirely. We’ll be actively developing our website and continuing to document our projects. We’ll also be stepping up our social media game to engage with people where they already congregate to find out more about what they’d like to see from Comingle. However, a community is only as valuable as its members, so we’ll be doing things to attract contributions from talented people, to jump start our forums and grow our how-tos section.

Andy and Paul founded Comingle after Andy helped a colleague make a vibrator in the Panamanian jungle out of electronic parts he had for his dissertation research (true story). Based on that experience, they realized that sex could be a great way to get people interested in learning electronics and coding, and that their Ph.D. research had given them all the skills they needed to make a great vibrator and to create new ways for people to interact with and experience sex toys in general.

(Here's a little workshop/talk we had in Good Vibrations in San Francisco)
Sexy Workshop On a Plane

We’re just as fancy as all those other fancy dildo companies, and to prove it, for the low, low price of $40,000, we’ll host a workshop for you and three of your friends on a private plane. You all get Mods and a bunch of accessories, and you’ll learn how to hack it at 40,000 feet (that works out to just $1.00/foot!). This sounds like a LOT of fun to us, so we’d love it if someone claimed this perk.
How will you make money if you give away all your designs?

We will sell components, kits, and sex toys to people who don’t have access to tools, the time, or the desire to make their own dildos from the ground up. For people who do want to make their own vibrators, we’ll have the info available, but for others, the documentation is as much about inspiring new ideas as it is about duplicating our products and projects.
Will you ship your products discreetly?

Yes, by default we will ship all products super discreetly in nondescript cardboard boxes.  For people who have a personal relationship with their mail carriers, though, we also provide an indiscreet shipping option.
What color will the Mod come in?

As you see in our photos and videos, the Mod could come in a dizzying array of colors. We'll offer the Mod in solid colors and with a metallic finish, and hopefully be able to offer glow in the dark and marbled colors as well. We'll communicate with our backers after the campaign about color options.
In your videos and How-to articles, I keep seeing different sizes and shapes of dildos? What's going on?

All the Mods you see in our documentation are prototypes. We made the different shapes to test different forms and to figure out how best to embed electronics in silicone. Here's a rendering of the shape of form of what you'll be getting. It won't have any rough edges, and the ports will have a cover to keep out water and lube.
What do you mean by Gender-neutral?
We tried to design this toy to be fun no matter what you have between your legs. It's designed to hit g-spots, prostates, clits, glans, and taints of all sorts.
What business do three white dudes have making sex toys for ladies?

First of all, butts. We’ve all got ‘em and our vibes are super good for all of them. Second of all, you’re totally right, we’re privileged. We had the benefit of having the opportunity to and encouragement to pursue education and careers in science and technology, and we’re really grateful for that. Sex is fun for everyone, and we hope that our work can help grow interest in technology, but we’ll always be looking for feedback from people with backgrounds, body types, and identities different from our own.

By leaving the design open and accessible, we encourage you to make the Mod truly yours. We've had beta testers tell us that certain vibration patterns didn't do it for them, and it was no problem for them to change the pattern or remove it completely.

Finally, we understand that different people like different things. We know that one shape of the Mod won't work for everyone. We hope that by having a successful campaign, we can produce the Mod in many different forms and continue to create resources for people wanting to create and modify their own toys.",36.0,6,"3 Campaigns
|","Atlanta, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-mod-multivibrating-open-source-dildo/pica

The money raised in this campaign will contribute to Tony's medical and personal bills. Let's show how much we appreciate/care for him . And whether he believes it or not he is relevant!


Thank you Phil,

Over a year ago, after taking care of my Mother for 10 plus years, she
passed away in my arms. Now I am going through some extremely tough
times, both mentally (from everything I've done and seen), physically,
personally and financially (As you might or might not know, the mental
and medical health care system in the U.S. is a tedious and expensive
process). Please, if anyone can help at all, I would greatly appreciate
it.

I thank you in advanced from the bottom of what's left of my heart.


Rest in Peace Momma, I love you.

Your support helps the uninsured 

Established in
November 2007, Christ Community Health Services Augusta offers affordable,

quality primary health and dental care to the uninsured and underserved.  

Since then, we have logged more than 70,000 patient encounters.
column4: >Patients with no health insurance are seen on a sliding fee scale that

column1:
starts at $25 for an office visit.  

Christ Community Health Services Augusta exists to
proclaim Jesus Christ as Lord and to demonstrate His love by providing

affordable quality primary healthcare to the underserved. 

Help us reduce Emergency Room visits and expand our services to the community.
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
column6: >You can help us expand our dental services

column1: The Historic

Widows Home in the Olde Town neighborhood of Augusta was built in 1887. 

Renovations
on the first floor were completed and The Ann Boardman Widows Home Health Center
opened for patients in August 2011. We are working to complete the second and

third floors to expand our dental care and physical therapy services. 

Our goal
is to raise $10,000 toward this project. We have already raised more than $850,000! Help us preserve a historic building

and make even more services available in our region.  All funds raised will go directly to the renovation costs.

We raised $2 million to complete phase one of the renovations. Now it's time to finish the 2nd and 3rd floors of the Widows Home and expand our services.

Emergency Room vs. Primary Care?

Christ Community Health Services provides an effective, economical alternative to the Emergency Room for those needing basic primary care.
<li><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column4: >Christ Community Health provides continuity of care

column1: <li><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column4: >Christ Community Health can effectively address long term health issues such as diabetes, high blood pressure, cholesterol and obesity.

column1: <li>
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Christ Community Health addresses the physical and spiritual needs of our patients

column7: >""Every time I walk in the building I feel the love.""

column1: When Joann came to Christ Community
Health Services Augusta she had lost her job and her health insurance.  She was suffering from high blood pressure
and the effects of a stroke.  Now, her
blood pressure is under control and she has found a medical home at Christ
Community.
“I had a stroke,” she says. “Then I had
surgery on both legs and open heart surgery. I always had insurance and never
really thought too much about what would happen if I didn't have it. When I
lost my job I was devastated. I didn't know what to do. My pastor told me about
Christ Community Health Services. I was very skeptical. By that time I felt
like nobody really cared. A lot of people treat you different when you don’t
have insurance.  I found that out the
hard way.
“I’d probably be dead right now if it
weren't for Christ Community Health because of my blood pressure. I would go to
the emergency room and they would give me something to bring it down but they
would never address the problem or what was causing it.”
“Christ Community Health is doing a
wonderful thing for the community.  Every
time I walk in I can just feel the love. The staff truly, truly cares about you.
They are there because they really, really care. There are no words to describe
how great they are.  Christ Community
Health came to my rescue.”
Joann is one of thousands who came to Christ
Community Health with nowhere else to go. Now, they know they have a medical
home where they will be treated with dignity and respect even if they don’t
have insurance.
Vision
In response
to God’s grace we desire to be a part of the redemptive work of Christ to the
economically, socially and spiritually impoverished communities of
Augusta.  We envision an incarnational ministry through a community of believers
who use their gifts to care for the poor.
Our primary means for accomplishing this is through health clinics which
provide excellent care physically, emotionally and spiritually.  We work
hand-in-hand with existing ministries as well as help create new ministries as
needed to bring Christ to the poor, crippled, blind and lame.
As a community of believers, we envision and earnestly long for the heart of
Christ to be developed in us so that we might truly love our neighbor and
redeem lives -- for if our hearts are not first healed by

Christ, our labor will be in vain.  All this is for the Glory of God.

www.cchsaugusta.org

www.facebook.com/cchsaugusta

Monica Singh's ""Path To Parsons""

ASFI, in collaboration with Make Love Not Scars, is determined to help Monica fulfill her dream of studying at Parsons, New York.

Monica was only 20 years old when her life changed forever. At the time she was a promising straight-A-student pursuing a modelling career in addition to an undergraduate degree from the prestigious National Institution Of Fashion Technology in New Delhi, India.  Monica would go visit her parents for holidays in the city of Lucknow between semesters. It was during one of her trips back home that the unfortunate incident occurred.

“I was driving when a friend called. He got me to roll my window down on the pretense of being nearby and having seen my car. As I rolled my window down, a man on the bike next to my car threw a cup of some sort of liquid on me. I had no idea what the substance was at first, in fact I initially thought it was hot coffee.”

Monica then tried to drive herself to the hospital but her legs gave way and she could barely function. Luckily a bystander spotted her and was kind enough to drive her to the closest hospital. By the time Monica reached the hospital, she realized she had been attacked with acid.

It turned out that the perpetrator was in fact the friend who had called her while she was driving. Monica had known him for 6 years prior to the incident. The ""friend"" had wanted to marry Monica and had repeatedly proposed to her, but she had rejected him on the grounds of pursuing her education and career.

In an effort to give Monica the best available treatment possible, her parents sold almost everything they owned. “My father said he would support me for as long as I wanted. However I wanted to finish my education and pursue my dreams.” So that’s what she did.

Monica went back to college and finished her education between multiple surgeries. “I didn't realize how bad my injuries were because for the first couple of months I didn’t see myself. Everyone would tell me I was fine but it wasn’t until I saw my face  by mistake that I realized how unrepairable it really was.” Luckily when Monica went back to college, all her classmates were very supportive and she worked very hard to make up for lost time. “I used to find it hard to talk and form words, it was like being a baby again!""

Despite numerous challenges, Monica was now more driven than ever before to pursue her dream in the fashion industry. She was soon interning for renown Indian fashion designer Manish Arora. And after applying to numerous fashion institutions around the world, Monica managed to receive a letter of acceptance from her dream school - Parsons in New York City.In the midst of developing her career, her loving father passed away. She is therefore determined to make him proud as she now pursues a degree at one of the top fashion institutes in the world.
Bellow is a letter written by Monica:
Dear All,
It's been almost decade since I've been labeled a Victim - a Victim of an acid attack, a Victim of society, a Victim of living life on my own terms.

Upon entering college I had achieved the 2nd highest score for the all-India entry exam at the National Institute of Fashion and Design. The day I learned of my exam score confirmed the fact that I was destined to pursue a career as a creative person. Being in Delhi and learning about fashion was my sole mission at the time. But when I came back home for the summer after my first year at college, a male friend who I had known for several years proposed to me. He wanted me to leave my parents and give up my life and education in the city. I highly objected and thus declined his proposal. His response to my rejection changed my life forever.

My fight against death began after the acid attack. Friends and family were unable to recognize me at the hospital after the incident and it took me an entire year to be finally move independently on a wheelchair. Nine years later at the age of 28 I am still considered abnormal looking within society, but have made it thus far.

I am now counting on the support of each and every one of you to make my dream into a reality. I have lost one major soldier where this battle is concerned - my dear loving father who used to support me in every possible way. But I still have hope that I can raise sufficient funds by my deadline for my tuition and living costs in NYC.
You may have a lot of questions after reading this, so do not hesitate to email and reach out to me. Many thanks for your support!
Monica Singh
What We Need &
A hand written letter By Monica herself!
A personalised video expressing her gratitude by Monica!
A chat over coffee with Monica herself!
A personalised fashion illustration by Monica!
A Monica designed T-shirt!
A day of Monica's time devoted to re-styling your closet!
The Impact

Short Summary
I am a 16 year old high school girl who lives in Orillia,
ON, Canada.  Growing up, I have been
pursuing sports, and now I have my first opportunity to represent Canada on a
World-class level! Cross Country
Mountain Biking has become my passion in the past few years, and I train day in
and day out to be the best racer possible.
My goal with this campaign is to raise money that will go
towards my trip to Norway for the World Championships.  With your help, I can fly across the ocean,
face new obstacles, and absolutely kill myself in the toughest race of my life.  This experience will further develop me as an
athlete, and as a possible future Olympian.
What we Need &
Norway is one of the most expensive countries to visit as a
foreigner
column2: everything is more expensive over there! The money raised will go

column1: specifically towards the plane ride there and back, the accommodation in Norway
with Team Canada, the Team Canada support fee, and of course all the food
(&amp
column2: for a skinny girl I eat a LOT).

column1: With all of these expenses added together, the total will
easily be 3 thousand dollars… now that’s a load of cash! Moral and emotional
support is much needed, but that won’t help me step on a plane
Norway-bound.
All contributions, big and small, will be GREATLY
appreciated… and I have many perks for generous donors!
Even if I don’t reach my entire goal, any donations that I did
receive will still go towards my trip!
The Impact
Contributions to this campaign will not only help me reach
my personal goals of making a mark on the International sports scene, but will
help Canada be as greatly represented at World Championships and help the sport
of mountain biking grow.
As a first year Junior Expert rider (ages 17 &
hope to reach top 20 in a field of extremely competitive girls and gain more
experience racing far away. All of my
hard training has been paying off this season as I have won Canadian
Championships, a Canada Cup, and a US Cup race.
Going into World Championships, I will be the highest-ranked Canadian
Junior female.
Hopefully, I can make Canada proud and have my best race yet
at World Championships.
Challenges
Naturally, I will face many new challenges in my Norwegian
experience. The first thing that comes
to my mind is trying to master the technical components of the race
course.  This will be my first
world-class race course, and it will be much harder than anything I have ever
encountered
mentally. But I am confident in my riding skills, training, and mental
toughness, and I know I can do amazing at World Championships.
Other Ways you can Help
Of course, I understand that not everyone can make a cash donation,
but that is only one form of support that I will immensely appreciate. Please share my campaign (using IndieGogo
sharing tools &amp
column2: word of mouth), and cheer for me on September 4, 2014 when I

column1: will be racing!

Thank you for taking the time to read this.

My name is Alex Brumbaugh. I have been interested in studying the human body, mind and spirit my whole life. I have deepened this connection with in my self though my yoga practice and would love the ability to share this with others. In order to do that in our culture I need a certification which requires a 200 hour training program. These training programs are costly and just out of my reach. I would love to feel like I can freely help and teach others and still with in the confines of the law. Will you help me to do this? The average cost of one of these trainings is $5000.

How will donating to me help this world? 

This 200 hour training program is the first stop on my list of alternative schools. The 200 hour yoga training is the gateway into being able to openly share and teach about your own personal yoga practice. I have developed my practice intuitively after breaking my back a few years ago. I have fully recovered thanks to yoga and would love the opportunity to share this intuitive knowledge with the greater community. I feel as if I am able to give simplified explanations and exercises to help others begin to understand how to feel this intuition with in themselves. And when people start to feel and follow their senses of intuition then things unfold magically and the vibration of our universe is raised. In short... Help me to help you. The next step after this 200 hour training is a 1000 hour massage training certification which cost an average of 16000 USD. I would use my 200 hour certification to raise the money to pay for the massage program. Then i would use the massage program to pay for Ayurveda schooling in India and become Ayurveda practitioner which would help to trasmute the current health care model and usher in a new paradigm of medicine and healing in the USA.

I would love to feel like I can freely help and teach others and still with in the confines of the law. Will you help me to do this? The average cost of one of these trainings is $5000.How will donating to me help this world? This 200 hour training program is the first stop on my list of alternative schools. The 200 hour yoga training is the gateway into being able to openly share and teach about your own personal yoga practice. I have developed my practice intuitively after breaking my back a few years ago. I have fully recovered thanks to yoga and would love the opportunity to share this intuitive knowledge with the greater community. I feel as if I am able to give simplified explanations and exercises to help others begin to understand how to feel this intuition with in themselves. And when people start to feel and follow their senses of intuition then things unfold magically and the vibration of our universe is raised. In short... Help me to help you. The next step after this 200 hour training is a 1000 hour massage training certification which cost an average of 16000 USD. I would use my 200 hour certification to raise the money to pay for the massage program. Then i would use the massage program to pay for Ayurveda schooling in India and become Ayurveda practitioner which would help to trasmute the current health care model and usher in a new paradigm of medicine and healing in the USA.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Martinez, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/yoga-teacher-certification-fundraiser/pica

(Image: December 2011, Children: Ori, Andy, Dannie)
<span style=""font-size: 14px
column2: >As happens in life, the most trying and difficult times can bring the most amazing smiles. These are the times that we learn the most about ourselves and what we can accomplish. We discover the full capability of what our limits are and how far we can go to make the impossible happen.

column1: <span style=""font-size: 14px
column2: >This amazing family carries these smiles out of love, joy, respect for each other and pure faith. They also carry them from the overwhelming amount of “life” that has happened to them in the past 2 years.

column1: <span style=""display: none
<span style=""font-size: 24px
column3: > Lets go back to the beginning

column1: <span style=""display: none
<span style=""font-size: 14px
column2: >Around 2 years ago, Michaela was diagnosed with Breast Cancer. After completing the required appointments and check-ups, her recovery plan was established and started. This put her off work, leaving Shawn as the sole income to support the family and all the bills.  Shortly into her chemo, it was discovered that Shawn required surgery to correct a hernia. This happened around the same time that his father required the same surgery. Shawn delayed his surgical procedure until Michaela completed her last chemo session. However, a pathology error was uncovered which directed another year of chemo treatments for Michaela. Within a short time, both Shawn and Michaela were facing unrelenting medical needs that did not allow for either to work full time placing this family in undue financial strain.

column1: <span style=""font-size: 14px
column2: >Normally, families have relatives for support and to rely on for additional help.  For Shawn and Michaela, their family was no exception. There were limitations but always support. Shawn’s mom had hip surgery which regrettably yielded an infection that took her away from her family much too soon. One Grandfather had a heart attack and another Grandfather passed away. The emotional strain on Shawn and Michaela was tested, but, also a testament to their marriage and their faith.

column1: <span style=""font-size: 14px
column3: >As time passed for Michaela to continue with her chemo treatments, life happened within their immediate family. The roof on the family home needed repair
column4: the family vehicle needed extensive repair, and during a routine dental check up, one of their daughters was advised she needed oral surgery and braces. With their reduced work schedule, the challenge became the simple things like clothing 3 daughters, feeding a family, paying a mortgage – the added challenge was to get the major items completed as well.

column1: <span style=""font-size: 14px
column2: >Recently, life happened again – in a devastating way. Their youngest daughter attended a doctor’s appointment for a lump that was found on her eye lid. A small surgery to remove it and a test later revealed that it was cancer, the diagnosis - Grade 1 Embryonic Rhabdomyosarcom. At 5 years old, she is undergoing chemo to fight this rare cancer, her hair is falling out and she maintains her beautiful smile.

column1: <span style=""font-size: 14px
column2: >When we sit back and look at the events of their lives, this family has been touched with cancer 3 times, 2 hernia surgeries, the death of 2 grandparents, reduced work for recovery and illness, dental surgery and braces, extensive repair on the family home and family vehicle, buying gas to travel out of town to all the appointments, keeping 3 girls fed and clothed and all of the other happenings of life, like birthdays, Christmas and church events, this family has not had a chance to relax and be a family for a really long time.

column1: <span style=""font-size: 14px
column2: >We wanted to introduce this amazing family to you, to show you a snapshot of their lives over the past 2 years. We hope that you can see the same thing that we do – they know what is important and they work as hard as they can to maintain it. We ask that you consider helping them, so that they can have more time together. We never know what this world will bring. We ask that you consider this strong, faithful family as a deserving recipient of any potential donation that you will consider. We ask that you help keep their smiles on their faces.

column1: <strong><span style=""font-size: 24px
We're not just asking for a random amount of money. If our goal of $7500.00 is met the money will be put to use the following ways:
<ul>
<li>
$2000.00 is set aside to keep the family van roadworthy for any trips required to both the local hospital for Dannie's chemo treatments, and to Sick Kids in Toronto.
<li>
With the eldest daughter needing braces the majority of what is left will be used for this procedure.

If we are unable to obtain our goal, all money will be spent to offset the cost associated with keeping the family van roadworthy. If we manage to exceed our goal, all donations will be used to pay off past debts including roof repairs, and perhaps contribute to an extra special Christmas for the family.
<strong><span style=""font-size: 24px

Sarcomas are cancers that develop from connective tissues in the body, such as muscles, fat, bones, membranes that line the joints, or blood vessels. There are many types of sarcomas. Rhabdomyosarcoma (RMS) is a cancer made up of cells that normally develop into skeletal muscles. The body has 3 main types of muscles.
<ul>
<li>
Skeletal (voluntary) muscles are muscles that we control to move parts of our body.
<li>
Smooth muscle is the main type of muscle in internal organs (except for the heart). For example, smooth muscles in the intestines push food along as it is digested. We do not control this movement.
<li>
Cardiac muscle is the main muscle type in the heart.

About 7 weeks into the development of an embryo, cells called rhabdomyoblasts (which will eventually form skeletal muscles) begin to form. These are the cells that can develop into RMS. Because this is a cancer of embryonal cells, it is much more common in children, although it does sometimes occur in adults.
We think of our skeletal muscles as being mainly in our arms and legs, but these skeletal muscle cancers can start nearly anywhere in the body. Common sites of RMS include:
<ul>
<li>
Head and neck (near the eye, inside the nasal sinuses or throat, or near the spine in the neck)
<li>
Urinary and reproductive organs (bladder, prostate gland, or any of the female organs)
<li>
Arms and legs
<li>
Trunk (chest and abdomen)
RMS can even start in some parts of the body that don’t normally have skeletal muscle
<span style=""font-size: 24px
We understand some people just can’t contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you're unable to help.
<ul>
<li>
Feel free to share this with the world. The more people see this, the more we will be able to help this very deserving family
<li>

We also welcome thoughts, prayers, messages, and well wishes for the family. The e-mail address helpthesnfamily@gmail.com has been set up for you to message the family, and on Christmas eve, when we've completed our fundraising, your messages, along with all donations will be given to the them.
","(Image: December 2011, Children: Ori, Andy, Dannie)

As happens in life, the most trying and difficult times can bring the most amazing smiles. These are the times that we learn the most about ourselves and what we can accomplish. We discover the full capability of what our limits are and how far we can go to make the impossible happen.

This amazing family carries these smiles out of love, joy, respect for each other and pure faith. They also carry them from the overwhelming amount of “life” that has happened to them in the past 2 years.
Lets go back to the beginning

Around 2 years ago, Michaela was diagnosed with Breast Cancer. After completing the required appointments and check-ups, her recovery plan was established and started. This put her off work, leaving Shawn as the sole income to support the family and all the bills.  Shortly into her chemo, it was discovered that Shawn required surgery to correct a hernia. This happened around the same time that his father required the same surgery. Shawn delayed his surgical procedure until Michaela completed her last chemo session. However, a pathology error was uncovered which directed another year of chemo treatments for Michaela. Within a short time, both Shawn and Michaela were facing unrelenting medical needs that did not allow for either to work full time placing this family in undue financial strain.

Normally, families have relatives for support and to rely on for additional help.  For Shawn and Michaela, their family was no exception. There were limitations but always support. Shawn’s mom had hip surgery which regrettably yielded an infection that took her away from her family much too soon. One Grandfather had a heart attack and another Grandfather passed away. The emotional strain on Shawn and Michaela was tested, but, also a testament to their marriage and their faith.
As time passed for Michaela to continue with her chemo treatments, life happened within their immediate family. The roof on the family home needed repair
column2: the family vehicle needed extensive repair, and during a routine dental check up, one of their daughters was advised she needed oral surgery and braces. With their reduced work schedule, the challenge became the simple things like clothing 3 daughters, feeding a family, paying a mortgage – the added challenge was to get the major items completed as well.

column1: Recently, life happened again – in a devastating way. Their youngest daughter attended a doctor’s appointment for a lump that was found on her eye lid. A small surgery to remove it and a test later revealed that it was cancer, the diagnosis - Grade 1 Embryonic Rhabdomyosarcom. At 5 years old, she is undergoing chemo to fight this rare cancer, her hair is falling out and she maintains her beautiful smile.

When we sit back and look at the events of their lives, this family has been touched with cancer 3 times, 2 hernia surgeries, the death of 2 grandparents, reduced work for recovery and illness, dental surgery and braces, extensive repair on the family home and family vehicle, buying gas to travel out of town to all the appointments, keeping 3 girls fed and clothed and all of the other happenings of life, like birthdays, Christmas and church events, this family has not had a chance to relax and be a family for a really long time.

We wanted to introduce this amazing family to you, to show you a snapshot of their lives over the past 2 years. We hope that you can see the same thing that we do – they know what is important and they work as hard as they can to maintain it. We ask that you consider helping them, so that they can have more time together. We never know what this world will bring. We ask that you consider this strong, faithful family as a deserving recipient of any potential donation that you will consider. We ask that you help keep their smiles on their faces.
What happens with the donations?
We're not just asking for a random amount of money. If our goal of $7500.00 is met the money will be put to use the following ways:
$2000.00 is set aside to keep the family van roadworthy for any trips required to both the local hospital for Dannie's chemo treatments, and to Sick Kids in Toronto.
With the eldest daughter needing braces the majority of what is left will be used for this procedure.

If we are unable to obtain our goal, all money will be spent to offset the cost associated with keeping the family van roadworthy. If we manage to exceed our goal, all donations will be used to pay off past debts including roof repairs, and perhaps contribute to an extra special Christmas for the family.
What is Rhabdomyosarcoma?

Sarcomas are cancers that develop from connective tissues in the body, such as muscles, fat, bones, membranes that line the joints, or blood vessels. There are many types of sarcomas. Rhabdomyosarcoma (RMS) is a cancer made up of cells that normally develop into skeletal muscles. The body has 3 main types of muscles.
Skeletal (voluntary) muscles are muscles that we control to move parts of our body.
Smooth muscle is the main type of muscle in internal organs (except for the heart). For example, smooth muscles in the intestines push food along as it is digested. We do not control this movement.
Cardiac muscle is the main muscle type in the heart.

About 7 weeks into the development of an embryo, cells called rhabdomyoblasts (which will eventually form skeletal muscles) begin to form. These are the cells that can develop into RMS. Because this is a cancer of embryonal cells, it is much more common in children, although it does sometimes occur in adults.
We think of our skeletal muscles as being mainly in our arms and legs, but these skeletal muscle cancers can start nearly anywhere in the body. Common sites of RMS include:
Head and neck (near the eye, inside the nasal sinuses or throat, or near the spine in the neck)
Urinary and reproductive organs (bladder, prostate gland, or any of the female organs)
Arms and legs
Trunk (chest and abdomen)
RMS can even start in some parts of the body that don’t normally have skeletal muscle
Other Ways You Can Help
We understand some people just can’t contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you're unable to help.
Feel free to share this with the world. The more people see this, the more we will be able to help this very deserving family

We also welcome thoughts, prayers, messages, and well wishes for the family. The e-mail address helpthesnfamily@gmail.com has been set up for you to message the family, and on Christmas eve, when we've completed our fundraising, your messages, along with all donations will be given to the them.",1.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Kingston, Canada",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/help-one-of-the-most-deserving-families-through-their-toughest-times/pica

Short Summary

Hey everyone! My name is Emily, and I am a nursing student at the University of Virginia. I am passionate about healthcare and helping others. This year, I got involved with the Global Medical Brigades. This amazing organization travels to countries all over the world to provide healthcare to under served countries. In late December, I will be traveling to Ghana with a group from the Global Medical Brigades to provide healthcare to some of the small villages within the country. We will be setting up a clinic that will see several hundred people in the few days we are there. Also, we will be making door to door visits within the community to encourage people to ask us questions about healthcare and to learn more about the culture of the villages. For many of these people, this annual clinic is the only way they have access to healthcare. We have the ability to make a huge impact on many people's lives because of this clinic.
What We Need

I am trying to raise about $1,300 for this trip. This money will help cover the cost of airfare and supplies we need to set up this clinic. Even if I do not reach my fundraising goal, every little bit helps! The more supplies we bring to Ghana, the more people we can help!
The Impact

The Global Medical Brigades is an international organization that provides healthcare to many different countries. The University of Virginia's Global Medical Brigades has been making annual trips to Ghana for several years now, and we have partnered with UVA's Global Dental Brigades to set up a joint clinic in country. Providing healthcare to under served areas has a rippling effect of positive changes. For example, we can help prevent diseases, such as HIV and malaria, through public education, vaccination, and medication, all of which will be provided at no cost to the people who come through our clinic.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not afford to make a monetary contribution at this time, there are other ways to get involved! Consider joining a brigade if you have the time to commit to it! You can find out more about all the different brigades at this website http://www.globalbrigades.org/. Spread the word about this amazing organization!

Thank you for all of yours belong with us and we couldn't be more grateful for the support from you all this time, we understand all of our backers' can't wait to receive the MedHub. 

Because of the COVID-19, the customs will be more stringent in reviewing special products such as desiccants. But we are actively communicating with customs on this issue. The MedHub has finished the production, we are in this shipping stage now. We will ship them as fast as possible.

Taking medication as prescribed is extremely important for the overall effectiveness of the treatment. This means taking the right dose, at the right time, as many times as necessary. It's hard to keep track of all this information, especially when you’re taking several medications multiple times a day.

No one wants to forget their medication, and many people worry about taking their medicine on time. Living with this anxiety all the time is not healthy and may even exacerbate what you’re trying to treat!
column5:
/>

But with MedHub, your medication organization is fully automated. MedHub will show you what medication to take at what time, and keeps track of each time you take or miss a medication. 

Meet MedHub⎯the smart medical intake adviser that makes it easy to keep track of your health status and make sure you take your medicine on time.MedHub is very easy to use: just place the pills inside and connect the device to our app on your mobile device to begin receiving reminders. Even those who have trouble using smartphones can use MedHub with no hassle.
column6: >
column10:
/>

It’s now easier than ever for you and your loved ones to stay on top of your medication schedules. MedHub allows you to choose each section title, drug name and dosage⎯ easily customizable for everyone.
column14:
/>

MedHub can also be used to connect with our BP Doctor Smartwatch, which allows you to receive reminders without using your mobile phone.
column15:
>

The reminders are simple: when it's time to take your medicine, MedHub's alarm will alert you to open the designated section and take your pills.

If you are busy, or feel no need to take the medicine at the time, you can press and hold the heart rate detect button to turn off the alarm.
column16: >MedHub’s storage capacity is 68ml, which is divided into three sections. Each section can easily store pills of all shapes and sizes.
column20:
/> Heart Rate Detection

MedHub not only stores your medication and reminds you when to take it, but also can measure your heart rate and blood oxygen levels, so you can monitor your own health.
column23:
>For an extra $20 contribution, you can add the blood oxygen measurement App.

It’s important that your body gets sufficient oxygen in order to sustain basic functions and make sure internal organs are performing at their best. Being able to keep track of your SpO2 levels and heart rate can aid in the early prevention of suffocation, apnea, hypoxia and also contribute to better sleep. On the MedHub, your blood oxygen readings will be displayed with heart rate readings.
column24:
>Searchable History

Once you’ve gotten set up, MedHub will automatically keep records of each medication and schedule you’ve added. This not only reminds you when to take your medicine, but also allows you to check which medicine you’ve already taken.

You can use this data to monitor your medication progress, confirm any missed medications, and help contribute to your health records and aid in your doctors’ diagnoses.
column25:
>Sealing Ring

MedHub includes a sealing ring which fully protects your pills from moisture and locks in 100% of their medicinal properties.
column27:
Shockproof

MedHub is travel-size and can be easily stored in pockets, bags, and more. The shell is made of aluminum alloy, and compared to other products made of plastic, MedHub has high impact and drop resistance and longer service life.

MedHub has a built-in desiccant that provides a dehydrating function to ensure that your pills won’t be affected by moisture. With an automatic detection function, MedHub can notify you when it needs to be replaced.

The MedHub has a built-in automatic moisture detector that runs once every hour to maintain appropriate moisture levels inside the device.

One desiccant will last 3-4 months depending on the humidity of the environment. If your home is humid, you may need more desiccants
column28:
if your home is drier, you may not need a desiccant at all.

If you are worried about humidity, when contributing you can add our desiccant exclusive perk, which includes 5 extra desiccants for only $5. ​

MedHub's built-in battery can maintain normal operations for up to 10 days and will remind you to charge the battery when it gets too low.

Become our referrer and help us share MedHub smart pill organizer to your friend, get a free set of MedHub, or be rewarded with 10% commission of every dollar you help raise for our campaign! Check out how to share↓:
column29:
>

Thanks for showing your support for our 2nd project - MedHub. Our team is made up of former employees of Mindray, Withings, and Misfit, as well as many professionals from the wearable wellness &
column30:
health industries. We were eager to provide an easier way for you to manage your pills and take them on time. With MedHub, you can reduce your missed medications by over 85% and make sure your medication works as intended. With your help, we believe we can bring an easier and more affordable way to manage and improve your health.

I don’t really know where to start with this, so I figured I would start with a little bit of a background.

My daddy worked in the construction field, starting at a really young age. Carpentry seemed to run thick in his family’s blood. He spent evenings and summers working for his uncles who owned their own businesses. By the time he graduated high school, he had already mastered the skill. He married, and within just a few short years, they had 4 children. Though he worked from sun up to sun down, I can honestly say that I never remember him complaining about having to go to work. It was his passion. If he wasn’t working, he was fishing, hunting, or cooking up something in the kitchen.

He has always been a family man. His best days were those that he could spend with family…not just his immediate family…but Sunday gatherings of family. He was always been a free hand, if you needed help. And, he was always there to listen, if you just needed to vent. His heart was full of love, and do just about anything to show that to you.

In 2000, he was diagnosed with Diabetes. He tried to still live a somewhat normal life, but “normalcy” slowly diminished. With the sun being too much for his diabetes-stricken body, he was gradually pushed out of his passion – his job. His work days become shorter and shorter because the sun was just too much for his body. Then, neuropathy started affecting his daily routine as well. He could no longer hold and grasp the tools, and lost his balance because of the numbness in his hands and feet.

Finally, a few years ago, he was rewarded Social Security Disability. He’s had to learn to live on that as an only income…an amount that he could’ve easily made in one week’s worth of pay, if he had still been able to do construction. He’s applied for Medicaid more times than I can count, but keeps getting denied. Why? We really don’t know. He doesn’t have assets totaling much, he isn’t faking the disease, and truly does need more than Medicare.

Since October, we have almost lost him several times. Though Im extremely lucky and happy that he’s alive, my heart still hurts so much for him. He had to have his leg amputated, because of gangrene setting in his bone. Once he was sent home for recovery, a lady came by once a week and fit him for his prosthetic. Every week, he would try it on, and it became a better fit. Finally, he had his last appointment in the office. They called him in, set him down, helped  put on his perfectly fit prosthetic that was made specially for him, and they assisted him as he walked around the office.

Little did he know, that appointment was just a mockery. They took off the prosthetic and told him that in order to take it home, he would first have to pay the balance that Medicare didn’t cover. That balance being almost $7,000.00. When he told them that he didn’t have that kind of money, they informed him that they didn’t allow financing for this either. So, he left…without the prosthetic, with no hope that he'd ever walk again.   

We have tried a several diabetic and prosthetic charities, but have gotten nowhere. This is really the last thing I know to do to reach out for help. I understand that times may be tough, so I’m asking that even if you cannot contribute that you pass the link to this page on. 50 years old is too young to be living life this way.

Hi
My name is Jade and I want to raise as much money and awareness for the charity ‘beyondblue’.
beyondblue is an awesome charity that is a national, independent, not-for-profit organisation working to address issues associated with depression, anxiety and related disorders in Australia.
Their aim is to build a society that understands and responds to the personal and social impact of depression, works actively to prevent it, and improves the quality of life for everyone affected.

With donations they can increase awareness of depression and anxiety, Reduce stigma and discrimination, Improve help seeking, Reduce impact and disability, Facilitate learning, collaboration, innovation and research through their programs, research and campaigns
I’m not affiliated with beyondblue but I wanted to lend a helping hand and raise as much money as possible to this fantastic charity that helps so many people.

column3: ><font color=""#4d4d4d""><font color=""#000000"">“<font><font size=""3""><i><b><a href=""http://www.ayitiresurrect.org"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target="""" title="""">Ayiti

column1: Resurrect is a team of visionary
artists, community builders, mental health specialists, and holistic
healers with bloodlines in Haiti and the African Diaspora. We have
organized ourselves as a grassroots delegation working in
collaboration with local Haitian organizations to facilitate
psychological and spiritual healing for Haiti’s quake-survivors
based on principles of solidarity, creativity, and collective
resilience.”
I read this mission statement on Ayiti Resurrect's website (check it out by clicking the link!), I knew
that it was destined for me to join this delegation
opportunity to reconnect with my Haitian roots and connect them to my
life's work of intuitive holistic healing and story medicine. For
five years, I have been deeply engaged in the work of healing myself
and helping others heal themselves. As a community organizer for
nearly ten years and a strong proponent of healing justice, emotional
justice, food security, earth restoration, and healing through the arts, it seemed as if
Ayiti Resurrect's mission was written especially for me.
January 4, with your help, I will travel with this delegation to
Leogane, Haiti to implement healing workshops that will empower
people to take their healing into their own hands and to provide
healing services as a part of a wellness clinic that Ayiti Resurrect
will facilitate. While all of my ground expenses are covered, I have
to raise money to cover my travel expenses and all supplies and
materials needed. </font></font></font></font>
a part of my workshop, I plan to co-facilitate a group healing
circle. Using the Source energy that is available to all of us, I
will demonstrate the power of hands-on energy healing when done in
groups and show how this method can be useful regardless of one's
level of training. I will also provide various tools including plant
medicine, animal medicine, crystal therapy, aromatherapy, musical
instruments and more. This will show how holistic healing, using
various methods to heal on multiple levels at once, can be far more
effective than using just one method at a time.
funding this campaign, you are helping people to heal from the very
recent trauma of the 2010 earthquake that ravaged the area. This is a
grassroots delegation, meaning there is no government bureaucracy
that will impede this work. If this campaign is not funded, there
will be a hole in the delegation's mental wellness and stress relief
component that I would fill as a holistic healing practitioner and a
great-granddaughter of Haiti.
depending solely on community to fund this project. The $3,500 raised
will pay for my flight and fees, healing tools and supplies, and
documentation materials. If I miss my goal and come up short,
documentation materials would have to be left out. This would be
devastating because it is of great importance that people of color
around the world are equipped with the proper tools to document their
experiences and tell their own stories. This is story medicine. The
telling of one's story allows that person to release trauma and heal.
The documentation and distribution of that story allows many people
to heal from that one person's offering of story. This is what I
intend to facilitate.
an incentive, I'm offering surprise personalized gifts for anyone who
donates just $10, Chakra balancing and Aura Clearing for anyone who donates $20, a Ra Sekhi healing session for anyone who donates
$50, and an Ancestor Consultation session in a West African
tradition for anyone who donates $100. These perks may be claimed
regardless of location at no additional cost to you. I look forward
to serving you in gratitude!
you believe in the power of healing and this endeavor resonates with
you, please tell others! Tell your parents and all of your friends,
tell your co-workers, your lovers, and anybody with the means to
contribute. Thank you for your help, I could not do this without you!
and Blessings,
Adisa

Imagine that the water you drink isn’t safe but you have to drink it anyway because you need to survive. That is the current situation of multiple households in Sre Chea Commune, Cambodia, and we, a group of youth participants in Youth Corps Singapore* leaders programme, believe we can change that by installing RainWater Harvesting Systems that have in-built filtration features. And we need your help in funding for these systems!

With a lack of accessibility to clean and safe water, many households in Sre Chea Commune collect and use water from nearby water bodies such as lakes. Hence, they face the risk of having long term illnesses such as malnutrition, typhoid and gastrointestinal illnesses due to the germs and bacteria present in the water. As such, we want to install RainWater Harvesting Systems (RWHS) in such poor households in the commune located in Cambodia. These systems would provide them access to clean water for drinking and cooking purposes.

For the families that already have these systems, they are highly grateful and are utilising it thoroughly as it guarantees water all throughout the year, whether it is the rainy season or not. However, there are still 81 poor households in the commune without such facilities. As a start, we would like to set up these systems in 15 of such households. However, as it costs $ 179 USD per RWHS, we need your help in funding for our project.

The villagers’ only ‘fault’ was being born into a village without proper water filtration systems. Can we hold that against them and let them suffer? With our knowledge and resources, it is our responsibility as part of the human race to push their progress and quality of living forward. There is nothing setting them apart from you and I other than their access to clean water. So let’s help in bridging that gap by providing them a basic necessity of life where every donation, whether small or big, will help us in achieving that goal! Let’s help restore their faith in humanity.

[*Youth Corps Singapore, a Division under National Youth Council, provides the breadth and depth of volunteering opportunities for youths through ad-hoc, regular and project-based service projects, with a focus on reaching out to causes such as education, environment, health, special needs, arts, sports and heritage.]

ЭЛИКСИР для удаления волос «ЛАДОДЕЯ» на основе семян крапивы.
<h2><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
column3: >Достаточно одного курса применения, чтобы избавиться от нежелательных волос раз и навсегда!

column1: <div>
<div>

Наши предки жили в ладу с природой. Она давала все необходимое для жизни. В таёжном лесу не было салонов красоты и различных SPA-комплексов, но имея в своем распоряжении баню и всю окружающую природу, наши прабабушки выглядели намного лучше, чем современные женщины.

column5: > Конечно, накладывает свой след темп современной жизни, экология больших городов, нерегулярное питание, неправильный сон и другие факторы. Но в большей степени, сказывается отсутствие знаний, которыми обладали наши предки. Секреты, которые позволяли сохранять молодость и красоту, крепкое здоровье и силу. Сегодня всё изменилось. Сегодня эти секретные знания вновь доступны для Вас.

column1: <h3> <i style=""font-weight: normal
column2: >Несколько лет назад, во время путешествия по Сибири,

column1: <div>

с нами поделились старинными знаниями о травах и плодах. Более ста рецептов из различных трав, корней, семян и плодов. Нам дали методики применения даров природы в повседневной жизни Есть рецепты для лечения и профилактики болезней. Кроме этого, много рецептов направленных на сохранение молодости и красоты.

Среди множества секретов, которые нам открылись, есть уже известные нам, но есть и те, которые мы раньше нигде не встречали. Один из таких рецептов - это средство для удаления волос «Ладодея». Достаточно одного курса применения, чтобы раз и навсегда удалить волосы в нежелательных для Вас зонах.

В состав эликсира «Ладодея» входит 7 компонентов исключительно растительного происхождения. Основой рецепта являются вещества получаемые из семян крапивы, произрастающей в Сибири.

Крапива - это уникальное по своим свойствам растение. Область его применения широка: от применения в пищу, настоек, кремов, масок, до крапивного волокна для ткани. И все приготовленное из этого растения имеет лечебный профилактический или косметический эффект.

Среди лекарственных растений крапива является лидером, которое получило всеобщее признание на планете. Это уникальное растение, уже в начале нашей эры, стали употреблять как лекарство, а в настоящее время оно успешно применяется в медицине, косметологии и кулинарии. Сегодня крапиву специально выращивают и культивируют во многих странах Европы, как ценное целебное растение.

Крапивы насчитывается десятки сортов и каждый сорт уникален, обладает собственным, ярко выраженным действием в определенной сфере. Как у многих других растений, у крапивы есть области полярного применения, например, листья укрепляют волосы и стимулируют их рост, а вещества находящиеся в семенах направленно действуют на истощение и удаление волос.

Проведенные нами испытания полученных рецептов из крапивы показали их точность и эффективность. При правильном приготовлении и использовании результат обеспечен. Elixir will now save your money, time, health and beauty.

The Ladodeya Elixir contains seven botanical components. The recipe is based on substances extracted from seeds of Siberian nettle.
Nettle is really unique by its properties. Its area of
application is vast: it is used in food products, extracts, creams,
masks. Nettle fiber is used even in production of fabric.
Anything made out of this plant has a healing, preventive or
beautycare effect.
Like many other
plants, nettle combines some antipodal properties. For example, its leaves
strengthen and stimulate hair growth, whereas substances
contained in seeds are good for hair exhaustion and
removal. Nettle is the queen of all curative herbs. It
has long been
granted unchallenged recognition across the globe.
This exceptional  plant was known and applied as a remedy yet at
the beginning of our era. Now it is successfully used in
medicine, beauty industry and cooking. Today, nettle is a farming
crop in many countries of Europe, cultivated as a valuable medicinal
plant. There are dozens of varieties of nettle, and each variety is like no
other, each has found its specific application in a
particular area.
Our tests of
nettle recipes have proven their accuracy and efficiency. Proper

There is no magic involved,

by nature to grant us its benefits.
The Ladodeya hair remover is

The Ladodeya Elixir includes

Each of us has a bespoken identity by birth, so

Any company engaged in the production of
