column1: ","RESUKO© is a new, exciting and innovative logic riddle from Switzerland. It is versatile, comes in many different styles and forms and therefore arouses enthusiasm in both young and old. It has the potential to might be considered equivalent with similar puzzles such as Sudoku, Battleship and Kenken. We launch this campaign on Indiegogo to spread the word about RESUKO© and to to raise the fundings for its distribution. We have been working for years on its fialization and now we are ready to go worldwide. You will get our great riddle RESUKO© and much more by purchasing our perks… Enjoy the drive!
Genesis

For me as an eager riddle solver – always in the search for new riddles – Sudoku, the on all sides present logic riddle, slowly became monotonous in the course of time: As Sudoku – invented by brilliant Mr. Leonhard Euler (1707-1783) – has its fixed dimensions of 9x9 fields and the numbers 1 to 9 are not expandables.

My mathematical analysis proved – without rotations, reflexions and exchanges – there exist only 46'656 different possibilities: 24x24x81. Therefore I was of the opinion that it was time for a new riddle to be invented: A riddle with infinite possibilities of both dimensions and forms and a closeness to global interest as for example cars have.

Everyone is sold on riddles of any kinds and velocity. Racing however is dangerous in real life, so we have brought the race on safe ground: Paper. Afterwards the streets came into play. Over time this riddle developped from an idea to a sketch. The first RESUKO© arose in June, 2009:
Still only meanless ""lines""...
From ""RACE"" to ""RESUKO""

When this idea has been consolidating, the question concerning a powerful and meaningful name has arisen. The final name “RESUKO” has been developed out of various initial names such as""highway riddles"", ""racing riddles"", ""Racetrack"" and ""Race"". The word ""Resuko"" is descended from the Japanese and means “race car”. My enthusiasm for RESUKO© did not remain undiscovered for a long time and the first inquiries for test riddles quickly arrived from the closer circle of acquaintances. The received feedback of the initial test phase was overwhelming throughout and therefore my decision was made to transform RESUKO© into a product. To discover the possibilities of RESUKO© we created a physical generator out of wooden cubes with which we simulated various riddle types and thus simulations discovered the infinite extendibility of RESUKO©. The design of the single elements has changed in the course of progression, so that in the end we figured out the most expressive symbolism: At first the circuit contained two lanes and there was also a tribune in the grid.

Finally RESUKO© was ripe for distribution. As manual production of riddles is principally uneconomical GameSky AG was founded, with which we planned to reach the zone of profit by means of an electronic riddle generator. Due to the fact that our business partner was mostly occupied with his own projects RESUKO© got neglected. In the meantime the company has been dissolved and the riddles – still manually created – are being provided once again directly by the inventor himself. The reader’s and publisher’s feedback on the new riddle RESUKO© was and remains exclusively positive. RESUKO© appeared in various newspapers such as “Tagblatt Zürich”, “Zürichsee Zeitung” and “MixLogik” over years. Our goal is to spread RESUKO© worldwide and not only locally since every single riddle solver is pleased with a new exciting riddle. That is where we need your help as a community to make RESUKO© popular and achieve our campaign goal. The advantage of RESUKO© is its linguistic independence, except its instruction manual.
Description
RESUKO© is a logic riddle, as for example Sudoku, Bimaru, Kenken etc. ONLY BETTER!

RESUKO© is not bound to dimensions nor language. Depending on the target audience a precise type of RESUKO© can be chosen (for children, infinite dimensions, forms, types and themes, coloured, difficulty levels, integrated advertisements etc.).
How to solve RESUKO
Guide: Complete both race tracks (circuit and test track) inserting the given elements in the grid including a pit lane and a parking lot. Thereby apply the following rules:
All elements of the respective line or column are listed in two lists outside of the grid.
The pit lane is situated parallel to four straight lines of the circuit on a clear grid area of 4x1 or 1x4 fields.
The parking lot is located in the single clear grid area of 2x2 fields.
The pit lane and the parking lot are never situated on a given gravel bed field.
The test track is markedly shorter than the circuit.
Tip: Before filling in the elements into the grid, strike all given elements off both lists and every used element while solving the puzzle.
Enjoy every drive!

Along with the initial idea of a newspaper’s and magazines’ riddle arose the expansion of RESUKO© into the digital world by means of a mobile application for iPhone, Android and Tablets, which we aim as an additional goal of this campaign. We also want children to enjoy RESUKO©: So we created a stamp set to create your own RESUKO© and painting which is ready for production.

RESUKO©’s inventor, Beat Almstädt, working as a full-time self-employed graphics designer for decades, hence – always in search of innovative and fresh ideas for his customers – has extended his creativity also to riddles. RESUKO© is only one of his numerous riddle inventions, nevertheless RESUKO© has the biggest opportunities to be established in the worldwide riddle market, thus we have selected RESUKO© for our campaign on indiegogo. The motives to launch a campagin on Indiegogo are easy: The publishers in Switzerland are relatively small and according to that have a limited sales and territory market only. RESUKO© was already published in Switzerland in newspapers, magazines and even professional riddle books and attained huge popularity among the riddle fans. We would like to provide worldwide access to RESUKO© and preserve its high quality and a reliable costumers’ service.
Campaign Goal
The donated capital will be used as follows:
50'000 USD for generator’s development (figures are based on the first efforts by GameSky AG)
5'000 USD for trademark protection
5'000 USD for public relations, advertisement and marketing
5'000 USD for programming of online shop
10'000 USD for development of mobile application as an additional goal.

One of our targets is also the realisation of a mobile application. The mobile app conveys the impression to the riddle solvers, that they are actually racing on their device. This proves again that RESUKO© is able to survive on modern platforms besides traditional media such as newspapers and magazines. If our goal of USD 65'000 is exceeded by USD 10'000, we will be able to program the mobile app as well.
Administration
Please do not hesitate to contact us in case of any questions in respect of our campaign or RESUKO©: info@resuko.ch.
We are glad to help in any matter.
Social Network
You can also find us on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube:
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Resuko/724787610942534
https://twitter.com/Resukoracers
http://youtu.be/XiCno1jJUjI
For more information about RESUKO please visit our homepage:
www.resuko.ch or write us an email: info@resuko.ch",8.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Zurich, Switzerland",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/resuko-the-race-puzzle--2/pica

Okay, so here goes. My goal is to raise money for cancer research. I have recently become even more aware of the effect it has on people after experiencing finding out people i know being diagnosed.  It is shocking how many people are effected by cancer, and if you could take some time out of your day to donate it could change a life. As some of you may know, running hasn't always been something i like, however i am running a 10K to raise money. Please, please donate and share.


Josh Cullinane

column8: >Paul Ryan is from England and engaged to Juliet Soupel from France. Paul followed Juliet to France to support her teaching career in the summer of 2014. After taki
column15: >ng some time to adjust to the new country living he tried to figure out his next step in life after spending many years managing bars and restaurants back in the UK.

column1: After 6 months an old dream I once had of indoor Crazy Golf popped into my head, dedicating it's design to the city we live in, Clermont Ferrand.  Since January we have both been working hard towards the goal of giving something new to the city and the people who live in it and we are finally in a position to start construction.

We want to make it as accessible as possible to everyone so looking to upgrade our handicap facilities  with the toilets, equipment and various construction adaptations to cater for anyone who wants to play.

In total we need in the region of £4,000 for

  • Upgrading the disabled toilets, as we need to widen the door, install a new toilet and sink to EU standards
  • Ensure all ramps, slopes and walkways are to the correct standards in and around the building and terrain of the course.
  • Putter extensions for wheelchair users
• Access to the bar and restaurant area and viewing platform over the course

The city of Clermont Ferrand boasts 2 bowling venues, 2 lazer game venues, 6 cinemas, Soccer parks, Rugby Parks, Go Karting, Ice Skating and even trampolining which a lot of these are hard for handicapped people to use fully. So when we set out to design the course we wanted to make sure that everyone can enjoy the crazy golf no matter of what age or ability.

There are a very large amount of families in and around the city, and France prides itself on family time which is why we really want to offer something new to the people and if it works then we will look to expand across the county one day.

Juliet's sister has been in  a wheelchair her whole life and we see what a struggle she has every day and often feeling excluded from activities. We are very excited to have her and her friends come along to play once we are ready to open.

Risks &
column2:
Challenges

To say this project has been problem free would be a big lie. We were almost ready to start in June but we had many problems with the building we wanted, especially in getting it safe for public use and the handicap upgrade would have reached easily to 30,000 euros just for lifts and fire escapes alone. It was very hard and really derailed the momentum we had generated over the 5 months running up to the decision to pull out.

column1: The silver lining in this setback was that we contacted a different landlord privately in a building we really wanted first but the rent was way too expensive. After a few meetings we agreed to a partnership and everything looks to be on track again with an opening date set for the end of October.

We had a big challenges on contacting all of the local success stories of the city to gain sponsorship or image rights to show them off on the course. Sport teams ASM Rugby and Clermont Foot, Volvic water and Michelin the 2 biggest exports to the city along with landscapes and architecture with the Volcanoes and Cathedral. We finally have their backing along with various councils, the mayor and most of all the bank who can see the potential in such a new business.

Other Ways You Can Help

People can help in many ways and not just by funding. Already we have had some people come forward to help with logo designs, construction and architecture so if you can offer any service to us that would be gratefully received. For those in the UK I know it's hard to get over here to help paint so don't worry about  this.
","Introduction

Access to the bar and restaurant area and viewing platform over the course

So when we set out to design the course we wanted to make sure that everyone can enjoy the crazy golf no matter of what age or ability.

There are a very large amount of families in and around the city, and France prides itself on family time which is why we really want to offer something new to the people and if it works then we will look to expand across the county one day.

Juliet's sister has been in  a wheelchair her whole life and we see what a struggle she has every day and often feeling excluded from activities. We are very excited to have her and her friends come along to play once we are ready to open.   Risks & Challenges To say this project has been problem free would be a big lie. We were almost ready to start in June but we had many problems with the building we wanted, especially in getting it safe for public use and the handicap upgrade would have reached easily to 30,000 euros just for lifts and fire escapes alone. It was very hard and really derailed the momentum we had generated over the 5 months running up to the decision to pull out.

The silver lining in this setback was that we contacted a different landlord privately in a building we really wanted first but the rent was way too expensive. After a few meetings we agreed to a partnership and everything looks to be on track again with an opening date set for the end of October.

Last Friday night, Michelle was smacked in the back of the head with a metal bat bouncing at the club helping out another security gaurd. She was knocked unconscious with her head split open and continuously beaten while she was out. She has 5 staples in the back of her head now along with 2 herniated disks in her cervical spine and is suffering from a severe concussion including constant extreme dizzyness, nausea, confussion, unable to concentrate, ringing in the ears and constant pain. Michelle has no medical insurance.

Since the incident, she has been to the ER twice which most of you can imagine the bills coming her way. She has also gone to her doctor a few times which is an automatic 90$ charge up front per visit and will need to see a neuro within the next week or two. Her perscriptions have already reached almost $300. This is her third severe concussion (other two sports related) so no one can tell when her symtoms will stop or when she will be fully recovered from this. She has been and will be out of work for quite some time now.

There will be a funraising event held on Michelles birthday, Thursday September 6th at Rumor 35 in South Amboy. The club has agreed to give her all the money that they make that evening. Each person over 21 will be charged 5$ and anyone under 21 will be charged 10$ at the door. The more people we can get, the better.

Any donation is extremely appreciated and helpful even if its a dollar. If you cant donate please keep Michelle in your prayers for a speedy, full, recovery.

My name is Piotr Radon and I was born with Total Amelia. It is a birth defect associated with the complete absence of all limbs. I am 19 years old now and as an adult I have lost the support of some organizations that used to help me, as they specialized in children’s help. The Polish Health Care system wants me to cope as healthy adults, forgetting my situation. (System chce abym radzil sobie jak inni dorosli zapominajac o mej sytuacji.) Now I am forced to find private sponsors, institutions or foundations myself to obtain help in the form of donations, either on a regular basis, or temporarily. I sincerely hope for Indiegogo to find necessary help and means to live my life as I wish.


Since Primary School I had received in-home tutoring in Dabrowa Tarnowska.
In 2011 I graduated from High School (IT profile) with very good results and I passed my final tests.

In 2012 another huge step for me - I started studying at the Polish-Japanese Institute of Information Technology in Warsaw. I am enrolled on a full-time programme with other students, which meant I had to move from my home town to Warsaw. It was a big challenge for me. I require round-the-clock care so my parents had to move to Warsaw with me and they had to quit their jobs which complicates our situation  As I mentioned, I am studying and I hope that with your help I will manage to collect funds for fee  and graduate and then be able to start a career. My dream is to become financially independent Take the burden off my parents’ shoulders. I believe that IT can give me a huge opportunity with my future career and I could be able to become an independent man, with the need for constant medical care.
Lack of limbs is not the only problem and barrier in my life that affects normal functioning. For a few years now my scoliosis has been getting worse. It puts pressure on my internal organs, e.g. lungs, which causes dyspnoea and respiratory tract infections. I also suffer from asthma. These conditions require constant treatment and the cost of medicine, physiotherapy and rehabilitation stays is far beyond the financial capabilities of my family.

Despite my disability I try to live the life of a healthy person. I develop my passions (civil aviation, passenger airplane piloting) and interests (music, IT, programming, history, politics and law). I am determined to achieve my goals (getting a job, becoming independent). But at this stage of my life I need your help. I cannot make it without it.

My last financial liability is the cost that my studies involve. Courtesy of His Magnificence Rector of the Institute I was temporarily excused from this fee (for one semester) but the school I chose is a prestigious one which means that the fee is much over our financial capacity. If you take on board the fact that I treat my studies as a huge life opportunity perhaps you will understand my fears and my problems.  Yet there is still the cost of my residence. It needs to be close to the university due to my mobility impairment and my parents’ general health condition.


I will be extremely grateful for you help. Additional information:
Piotr Radon / private website
Piotr Radon / Facebook profile Fundraising

Who We Are

Planned Parenthood of Southeastern Virginia has been the most trusted provider of affordable women's health care and honest, accurate sex education in Hampton Roads for close to 50 years. One of our main education programs involves comprehensive information sessions on reproductive health, birth control and STI/HIV prevention and testing with domestic violence survivors living in women's shelters across the community. Many of these women are uninsured and have gone way too long without a well-woman exam and breast and cervical cancer screening. We don't receive any state or federal assistance for clinical services and are unable to provide free services without grant or donor funding.
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp

Our goal is to provide these women in desperate need of basic health care with free well-woman exams to ensure they are healthy as they embark on the next part of their lives. A well-woman visit at our health center typically costs around $150 and includes the exam and the lab work needed for cancer screening. While this is a fraction of the cost at a private provider, it's still difficult for many women living in shelters to pay. We would like to raise $5,000 to provide exams and cancer screening to at least 25 women in desperate need of this care. The total will also assist women who may need a follow-up screening or further care for an abnormal result.
If you contribute to this campaign, you can feel secure in knowing you may have saved someone's life
column2: and at the very least, you have given an underserved, vulnerable woman a better chance at a healthy, happy future.

column1: <div>
The Impact

Unfortunately, the state does not provide the type of safety net that so many domestic violence survivors and homeless women living in shelters need to help them successfully move on with their lives. We would like to offer these women a safe, confidential, personal environment to receive health care, something that may be traumatic after a violent experience. We feel that these women have been through enough pain and the least we can do is provide them with a basic health screening to allow them peace of mind and the ability to start fresh. Many of these women have children
column2: they need to remain healthy and able to care for them.

column1: <div>
Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone is able to contribute money, but if you care about this cause, please share with your friends and contacts. Every little bit helps and will move us closer to providing necessary health care for some of our most vulnerable community members!

column2: and at the very least, you have given an underserved, vulnerable woman a better chance at a healthy, happy future.

column1: The Impact

Unfortunately, the state does not provide the type of safety net that so many domestic violence survivors and homeless women living in shelters need to help them successfully move on with their lives. We would like to offer these women a safe, confidential, personal environment to receive health care, something that may be traumatic after a violent experience. We feel that these women have been through enough pain and the least we can do is provide them with a basic health screening to allow them peace of mind and the ability to start fresh. Many of these women have children
column2: they need to remain healthy and able to care for them.

column1: Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone is able to contribute money, but if you care about this cause, please share with your friends and contacts. Every little bit helps and will move us closer to providing necessary health care for some of our most vulnerable community members!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Hampton Roads, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/providing-free-well-woman-exams-to-survivors-of-domestic-violence/pica

column1: ","The
Rio Grande Healthy Living Park in Alamosa, Colorado continues to move
forward in accomplishing goals towards educational, cultural, and
economic opportunities - all centered on our rich San Luis Valley
agricultural heritage. Through its current planning process, the
community has expressed a strong desire for a fruit tree orchard and
we are excited to put this plan into action!
Now
you have the opportunity to become a part of this living, growing
initiative! With your contribution of $100 or more, you can purchase
a fruit tree towards the creation of an orchard to be planted during
this 2015 growing season.  Any remaining funds will be used to build fencing on the property in order to keep out pesky animals.

What's our story?

uOttawa Quidditch recently celebrated our fourth year after Mama Clare Hutchinson and Mama Tegan Bridge created us in January 2011 . Last year both the Gee-Gees and Maple Rush qualified for World Cup VII, representing Canada on the International level.  This year Canada has branched off from the International Quidditch Association with a new governing body, Quidditch Canada.  With this split comes a national tournament encompassing all of Canada.  This is the first time ever that Eastern and Western teams will clash for the title of Canadian Champion.  Due to circumstances beyond our control Ottawa Maple Rush will not be participating under their own banner
column2:
the players will be joining a community team  made up of players from other Ontario teams who also want to compete at Nationals.  Helping these players travel to B.C. will ensure that uOttawa Quidditch is represented at the first National Championship.  The funds raised will cover travel cost and food.

What do we need and why do we need it?

In this campaign we are asking for $4000.  This will help cover the travel costs that each player will incur while making their way to Burnaby.

We have a variety of perks to choose from including the brand new Maple Rush jerseys!

The Impact

We know we aren't the only team traveling to Burnaby but we sure hope we are the sweetest.  You've helped this club get to World Cups in the past two years and we can't stress how thankful we are for all of that help.  We would love the chance to represent our school on the national level, and only through your help this is possible.

Stretch Goals

At $500 chaser Kera Lanouette has volunteered to be pie'd in the face. (This will be video taped and sent to the funder who helps us reach that amount)

At $1000 the team will take a Polar Dip in the Pacific Ocean.  This will be filmed and sent to you for your viewing pleasure!

Other Ways You Can Help

column1: • Tell everyone you know about the awesomeness that is uOttawa Quidditch !
• Share this link through all your social media!

Thank you for you all of your support!

We are spending 2 hours a day at the most for exercise.  Did you actually realize that we are spending more than 8+ hours a day in a sitted position? 

 

e v o s s  is an air cell cushion originally developed for the disabled community as an innovative solution for Decubitus ulcers (a.k.a bedsore).  It is a cushion that redistributes the individual's sitting pressure, reduces shear force and promotes blood circulation. 

 

  • Unparalleled comfort only  e v o s s  can deliver  - Just throw yourself on  e v o s s  and it will take care of the rest.

  • Reasonable price for every individual - Now you can enjoy the ultimate air cell cushion product at 60% off of the medical / healthcare market price.
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/DZzo5l-K774?autohide=1&amp
• Precision manufacturing in house (Not an OEM or supplied from third party vendors) - Manufactured by master craftsmen who have more than a decade of experiences
<ul>
• Lifestyle cushion that goes with you whenever you need it - Use however / whenever you want it be.
• Simple to use. No age or gender constrains.  Just enjoy  e v o s s  and share it with your beloved ones.  That's our ultimate goal after all.
We are under the greatest body pressure on our back when we are sitting.  If you sit more than 8 hours a day, you will have more than 2.7 times of your bodyweight on your back.

Simple, but more than enough!  The  e v o s s  air cell cushion makes the maximum contact to your body by contouring every corner of the contacted area.  This will reduce the pressure level on your body significantly and promise you the ultimate comfort even for a long duration of sitting.

• As you are sitting on the  e v o s s  cushion, the contact area deforms and contours the shape of your body.  This will lead your condition to the maximum contact with  the cushion that reduces pressure level significantly.
•  Also, with this condition on, the blood vessel gets much less compression and helps better blood circulation
• All of these can be done with our optimized cell designs, namely hexagonal and octagonal shaped cells depends on your body shape and weight.
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/vg0eVOZ0W7g?autohide=1&amp
<div>
<div><div>
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/P8u67b61LpU?autohide=1&amp
If you are not satisfied with  e v o s s,  simply return the item within 30 days.
We guarantee your 100% satisfaction.

<div>

We see that there are so many people out there who need our help.  A 10% of neb 's profit goes to supporting on building a school in the communities in need. Please join our long journey to make the better World.
<div>
<div>
Hello, I’m Kui Hwang.

My job is to engineer special rubber products in the semiconductor industry, and am head of Research and Development at Seal Tech Co., Ltd.  We manufacture seal solutions that are critical to producing the semiconductor chips used in electronics.  Understanding the properties rubber has helped me envision helpful applications for living a better life.  I wanted to share this knowledge and my expertise.  With this goal in mind, I developed a product for wheelchair bound individuals

The clear distinction between the cushions I developed and the ones on the healthcare market was the highly set cost to the consumer.  I was able to see that the high price tag of the wheel chair cushion is creating a special market that is only applied for disable communities and I needed to develop the entire process from the scratch in order to create one that is reasonably priced, and more accessible to everyone, like myself.

While I was developing the  e v o s s  from the scratch, I began to use it for myself.  I was experiencing discomfort and back pain from working 16+ hours a day and those issues turned out to real improvements to the product.  I am beginning to be convinced myself that these solutions can help so many others. My role in Seal Tech company allowed me to develop what inspires me, and as I noticed growing trends in the wellness industry, I wanted to start with some healthcare products that have some story with it.

This is how neb was born.  neb’s goal is to improve your quality of life and contribute to your lifestyle.  We consider core values to be caring the people that make up our center circle: family, friends and those you love.  We think wellness should be a personal story, and neb would like to be a part of yours by helping and supporting with advanced quality products.  Our vision is to develop  e v o s s  to support all areas of your life.  For this vision, we need your help.  Please join us as we develop a better life with you, your family, and your friends.
Thank you for your support.

Are you passionate about swimming?
Do you want to have more fun while improving and swim even better?
We're here to make your swimming workout WAY more entertaining with the Next generation swim tracker with a built-in coaching feature
<div>

Whether you’re a beginner, amateur, or professional, have more fun and swim smarter. 
improve your swimming technique with the Swim Wise app.
Short Summary
My name is Yacov Avramov, I’m from Israel the High tech nation and I love to swim.

I swim around 2.5km twice a week and have really good fun. 
I was trying a lot of swimming track apps with my Apple watch, but still, there was something missing.

As an entrepreneur and restless guy  [I run  an e-commerce fitness store in Israel (www.ygl.coil) as well as e-commerce support service (Magento-wise.co)] I was thinking to make the next generation swimming app tracker.
I am making the app that I wish I had when I was trying to get some feedback and insights about my swimming session.
I feel like I have a unique perspective to review my swimming sessions because I really want to know how I'm improving after each session and get positive encouraging insights.

All swimming trackers applications I've tested delivers basic swimming summaries without personal insights or personal suggestions.
After each swim, I was getting only basic ""cold"" matrics summaries.
So I hired some amazing developers and UI &
column2: UX specialist, all swimmers, we just had to think, what would make us happy after every swimming session. We have implemented some of our insights on our new iPhone &amp
column3: Apple watch app called SWim-WiSe (https://www.swim-wise.app)

column1:
Whether you’re a beginner, amateur, or professional, have more fun and swim smarter. 
improve your swimming technique with the new SWim-WiSe app.

Swim wise Apple watch app
Be sure you’re on track while swimming:
Apple watch detects your style and precisely tracks every stroke while you swim.
Our sophisticated app records your swimming data and displays average speeds compared with your last laps while you swim.

We have finished our Apple watch app development and it feels great.
It really keeps you on the right path while swimming
Swim wise iPhone app -  where the magic happens

After each swimming session, SWim-WiSe app, with its built-in coaching features, delivers amazing swim metrics and insights for your whole session and breaks down each swimming technique you performed.
All this data gets magically delivered to your iPhone or iPad right after you get out of the water.
Swimming summaries include detailed statistics, highlights, technique improvements, new records achieved, encouragement tips, and great analytics based on your past swimming sessions.
Get to know your swimming characteristics much better with In-depth analysis:
<div>
<div>
Just after you get out of the water
Be amazed by the insights created for every swimming session and much more:
✅Deep swimming analytics generated just for you
✅Get encouraging, thoughtful suggestions delivered right after each swimming session
✅Be notified for every improvement you achieve
✅Learn about new swimming records you’ve achieved
✅Know how to improve your next swimming session with our built-in coaching feature
✅Get swimming technique improvement suggestions
✅Improve your SWOLF, Distance Per Stroke score, etc.
✅Be notified for every improvement you achieve
✅See your swimming data in a wonderful visual breakdown
✅compare all your past sessions etc.

About Me
Hello!
It’s time to get something off my chest, literally. My name is
Dylan and I’m a trans guy (FTM) who needs your help to raise funds for top
surgery. I’m a youth worker, bike educator, gardener, and DIY enthusiast who
lives in Boston, Massachusetts. My goals for this year in addition to getting
top surgery also include completing a cross-country bike tour and applying to grad
school for urban planning.
For me, top surgery is medically necessary and will help me
to feel comfortable in my own body. I have never fit neatly into the gender
assigned to me at birth and puberty did not do me any favors. I have used
binding to hide the shape of my chest since I was in high school. But let’s be
real, binding can be physically uncomfortable and makes it difficult to
exercise because it compresses my chest. Although it doesn’t stop me from
swimming or biking, two of my favorite activities, it sure does present its own
physical, social, and emotional challenges from day to day. As I become more
secure in my masculinity, I am finding it harder to reconcile with my chest.
I recently read a great piece of advice from an essay on
transitioning. It said, “Know what you need. Get help. Be patient, but know
when you’ve waited too long.” I have waited 6 years for surgery and I know it
is time to get to where I need to be. Now, I just I need your help to do it.
<h3><b>My Health Insurance
Denied My Claim
It’s all too common of a story for trans individuals who are
interested in gender confirmation surgery. Because my state-sponsored health
insurance excludes top surgery from coverage, I’m looking at paying $10k
out-of-pocket. My appeal was denied and my search to find an inclusive private
health insurance has been drawn out and largely unsuccessful. Most insurers
only offer the coverage to large group plans, but not to individuals or small
businesses. The letter from my insurance company denying me the coverage stated
that it was not barring me from pursuing the services, but that I would be
responsible for paying them in full. Understandably, a $10k price tag does create
a substantial financial barrier that is hard to overcome alone.
I have saved $7k on my own over the past year. How you ask? I’m
a thrifty person and I’ve made it my mission to see that I meet my goal. If
you’ve met me you know that I’ve taken a few notes while watching TLC’s Extreme Cheapskates. I bike year-round, bake my own bread, and enjoy DIY reuse projects.
Still, since most of my youth work jobs are seasonal, my savings plateaued this
winter with my bills catching up to me. I am in the final stretch and I need
your help to raise the remaining amount of $3k!
Budget Breakdown
All-inclusive Surgery/Doctor’s Fee  $9,500
Total Cost    $10,000
Dr. Richard Bartlett is located in Brookline, MA so there is
no additional cost for travel. His all-inclusive fee includes the cost of the
anesthesiologist and the facility. The cost of living during recovery was
estimated to include wages lost for one week of work, the cost of ¼ of my
monthly rent, and other small recovery related expenses. Note that I have added
$250 to my fundraising goal to compensate for the service fees charged by Indiegogo.
The Perks!
Aside from the good feelings that come with donating to a
cause that can truly change a person’s life for the better, you can also look
forward to a special personalized or handmade gift.
$10 Thank You Card – A thank you card with a personalized
message to show my appreciation for your support.
$20 Mini French Bulldog Prints (Set of 2) – Who doesn’t love
cute photos of Frenchies?! Get two mini square prints of Opie, the dog I live
with, looking super adorable from a grab bag of 12 different photos. A big shout out to my roomies, Mackenzie and Corie, for their help with this project!
$25 Hand-stamped Bandana – These bandanas are made using homemade
stamps of glasses, mustaches, or bike gears. They work great as handkerchiefs
too. How dapper! They are available in light blue and royal blue.
$50 Etched Wooden Spoons (Set of 2) – Using a wood burning
technique, these Pinterest-inspired mixing spoons are decorated to make a great conversation piece
at your next dinner party. Cook or bake something delicious with them and then
share it with me, please.

How Can I Help?
Please help me reach my goal either through a contribution
or by sharing this link with friends, family, and coworkers. The more people
you can reach out to, the better. It can be as easy as hitting the share button to post this fundraising link to your fav social media website. It is super simple and will help me out a lot!

another way, please let me know. I’ll be looking for people to spend time with
me or help cook me meals when I’m recovering for the first week after surgery. I’ll be

","About Me
Hello!
It’s time to get something off my chest, literally. My name is
Dylan and I’m a trans guy (FTM) who needs your help to raise funds for top
surgery. I’m a youth worker, bike educator, gardener, and DIY enthusiast who
lives in Boston, Massachusetts. My goals for this year in addition to getting
top surgery also include completing a cross-country bike tour and applying to grad
school for urban planning.
For me, top surgery is medically necessary and will help me
to feel comfortable in my own body. I have never fit neatly into the gender
assigned to me at birth and puberty did not do me any favors. I have used
binding to hide the shape of my chest since I was in high school. But let’s be
real, binding can be physically uncomfortable and makes it difficult to
exercise because it compresses my chest. Although it doesn’t stop me from
swimming or biking, two of my favorite activities, it sure does present its own
physical, social, and emotional challenges from day to day. As I become more
secure in my masculinity, I am finding it harder to reconcile with my chest.
I recently read a great piece of advice from an essay on
transitioning. It said, “Know what you need. Get help. Be patient, but know
when you’ve waited too long.” I have waited 6 years for surgery and I know it
is time to get to where I need to be. Now, I just I need your help to do it.
My Health Insurance
Denied My Claim
It’s all too common of a story for trans individuals who are
interested in gender confirmation surgery. Because my state-sponsored health
insurance excludes top surgery from coverage, I’m looking at paying $10k
out-of-pocket. My appeal was denied and my search to find an inclusive private
health insurance has been drawn out and largely unsuccessful. Most insurers
only offer the coverage to large group plans, but not to individuals or small
businesses. The letter from my insurance company denying me the coverage stated
that it was not barring me from pursuing the services, but that I would be
responsible for paying them in full. Understandably, a $10k price tag does create
a substantial financial barrier that is hard to overcome alone.
I have saved $7k on my own over the past year. How you ask? I’m
a thrifty person and I’ve made it my mission to see that I meet my goal. If
you’ve met me you know that I’ve taken a few notes while watching TLC’s Extreme Cheapskates. I bike year-round, bake my own bread, and enjoy DIY reuse projects.
Still, since most of my youth work jobs are seasonal, my savings plateaued this
winter with my bills catching up to me. I am in the final stretch and I need
your help to raise the remaining amount of $3k!
Budget Breakdown
All-inclusive Surgery/Doctor’s Fee  $9,500+ Cost of Living During Recovery    $500
Total Cost    $10,000
Dr. Richard Bartlett is located in Brookline, MA so there is
no additional cost for travel. His all-inclusive fee includes the cost of the
anesthesiologist and the facility. The cost of living during recovery was
estimated to include wages lost for one week of work, the cost of ¼ of my
monthly rent, and other small recovery related expenses. Note that I have added
$250 to my fundraising goal to compensate for the service fees charged by Indiegogo.
The Perks!
Aside from the good feelings that come with donating to a
cause that can truly change a person’s life for the better, you can also look
forward to a special personalized or handmade gift.
$10 Thank You Card – A thank you card with a personalized
message to show my appreciation for your support.
$20 Mini French Bulldog Prints (Set of 2) – Who doesn’t love
cute photos of Frenchies?! Get two mini square prints of Opie, the dog I live
with, looking super adorable from a grab bag of 12 different photos. A big shout out to my roomies, Mackenzie and Corie, for their help with this project!
$25 Hand-stamped Bandana – These bandanas are made using homemade
stamps of glasses, mustaches, or bike gears. They work great as handkerchiefs
too. How dapper! They are available in light blue and royal blue.
$50 Etched Wooden Spoons (Set of 2) – Using a wood burning
technique, these Pinterest-inspired mixing spoons are decorated to make a great conversation piece
at your next dinner party. Cook or bake something delicious with them and then
share it with me, please.
$100 A Beard Scarf – Beards are all the rage. Unfortunately,
I can’t grow one yet, but I sure can crochet one! I’m willing to customize each
to make sure it fits too. PS I learned how to crochet just for this project and
you’ll be impressed with the results.

$125 Eggshells for Eggs Combo Pack - This awesome perk was donated by my friend, Allie, who runs Eggshells for Eggs, an Etsy shop full of rad vintage and repurposed jewelry and clothing. Maria is a Portuguese woman living from cleaning offices. She’s 30 years old and she has her teeth damaged since her youth.
I and other friends are trying to find support to make her feel prettier. It’s also a health issue, once her damaged teeth are much more likely to get infected.
All dental care in Portugal is expensive and Maria won’t have enough money to do it. She has been observed by doctors and this is the amount they ask her for the entire reconstitution she needs.
Maria loves to smile :-) Help her doing it!

Eu e outros amigos estamos a tentar arranjar apoio para a fazermos sentir mais bonita. É também uma questão de saúde, uma vez que os seus dentes estragados são muito mais propensos a infeções.
Os tratamentos dentários são caros e a Maria não terá dinheiro suficiente para os fazer. Foi vista por médicos e este é o valor que lhe pedem para toda a reconstituição de que precisa.
A Maria gosta muito de sorrir :-) Ajuda-a a fazê-lo!
